questions.text: A patient was on treatment for multibacillary leprosy for the last three months. Now the patient developed easy fatiguability, decreased interest in work, and pallor on examination. What drug is responsible for the patient's symptoms:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Dapsone It causes anemia and can increase/decompensate pre-existing anemia If hemoglobin is less than ten gm%, start iron, folic acid, and ascorbic acid and advise the person to take a high protein diet along with MDT

Highyeild:

Adverse effects Dapsone is generally well tolerated at 100 mg/day or less. Mild haemolytic anaemia is common. This is a dose-related toxicity—that reflects oxidising property of the drug. Patients with G-6-PD deficiency are more susceptible; doses > 50 mg/day produce haemolysis in such subjects. Gastric intolerance—nausea and anorexia are frequent initially but decrease later. Other side effects are methemoglobinaemia, headache, paresthesias, mental symptoms, and drug fever. Cutaneous reactions include itching, allergic rashes, fixed drug eruption, hypermelanosis, phototoxicity, and rarely exfoliative dermatitis. Hepatitis and agranulocytosis are rare complications.

questions.text: Dapsone is used for treating bacterial and fungal infections and for immunomodulatory actions. What is the mechanism of dapsone for these indications?

options.label: B
options.text: Inhibition of ergosterol in cell membranes

options.label: D
options.text: Competition with PABA in the folic acid synthesis

questions.correct_answer: D. Competition with PABA in the folic acid synthesis
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Competition with PABA in the folic acid synthesis

Highyeild:

Dapsone structurally it resembles PABA It inhibits dihydropteroate synthase and decreases folic acid synthesis NOTE: anti-inflammatory effects of Dapsone inhibition of tissue damage by neutrophils, inhibition of neutrophil myeloperoxidase activity, and respiratory burst it acts as a free-radical scavenger

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. Inhibition of cell wall synthesis drugs- For example, Beta lactams antibiotics Option: B. Inhibition of ergosterol in cell membranes-Antifungals like azole group. Option: C. Inhibition of protein synthesis- Example- Aminoglycosides, Tetracyclines, Macrolides.
